Client module¶

A client application for messaging. Supports sending messages to users who are online, messages are encrypted using the RSA algorithm with a key length of 2048 bits.

Supports command line arguments:

python client.py {server_name} {Port} -n or --name {user_name} -p or -password {password}

  1. {server_name} - the address of the message server.

  2. {Port} - the port on which connections are accepted

  3. -n or –name - the name of the user to log in with.

  4. -p or –password - the user’s password.

All command line options are optional, but the username and password must be used in pairs.

Usage examples:

  • python client.py

Launch the application with default settings.

  • python client.py ip_address some_port

Launching the application with instructions to connect to the server at ip_address:port

  • python -n test1 -p 123

Launching the application with user ‘test1’ and password ‘123’

  • python client.py ip_address some_port -n test1 -p 123

Launching the application with user ‘test1’ and password ‘123’ and the command to connect to the server at ip_address:port

client.py¶

The module being launched contains a command-line argument parser and application initialization functionality.

client. arg_parser ()

Command line argument parser, returns a tuple of 4 elements:

  • server address

  • Port

  • User name

  • password

Performs a check for the correctness of the port number.

database.py¶

class client.database.ClientDatabase(name)¶

Wrapper class for working with the client database. Uses SQLite database, implemented with SQLAlchemy ORM and the classical approach is used.

class Contacts(contact)¶

Class - mapping for the contact table.

class KnownUsers(user)¶

Class - display for the table of all users.

class MessageStat(contact, direction, message)¶

Class - display for the statistics table of transmitted messages.

add_contact(contact)¶

A method that adds a contact to the database.

add_users(users_list)¶

A method that fills in a table of known users.

check_contact(contact)¶

A method that checks whether a contact exists.

check_user(user)¶

A method that checks whether a user exists.

contacts_clear()¶

A method that clears a table with a list of contacts.

del_contact(contact)¶

A method that deletes a specific contact.

get_contacts()¶

Method that returns a list of all contacts.

get_history(contact)¶

A method that returns the history of messages with a specific user.

get_users()¶

Method that returns a list of all known users.

save_message(contact, direction, message)¶

The method that stores the message in the database.

transport.py¶

class client.transport.ClientTransport(port, ip_address, database, username, passwd, keys)¶

A class that implements the transport subsystem of the client module. Responsible for interacting with the server.

add_contact(contact)¶

A method that sends information about adding a contact to the server.

connection_init(port, ip)¶

The method responsible for establishing a connection to the server.

contacts_list_update()¶

A method that updates the contact list from the server.

key_request(user)¶

A method requesting the user’s public key from the server.

process_server_ans(message)¶

The method is a handler for incoming messages from the server.

remove_contact(contact)¶

A method that sends information about deleting a contact to the server.

run()¶

A method containing the main cycle of the transport flow.

send_message(to, message)¶

A method that sends messages to the server for the user.

transport_shutdown()¶

A method that notifies the server of the client shutdown.

user_list_update()¶

A method that updates the list of users from the server.

main_window.py¶

class client.main_window.ClientMainWindow(database, transport, keys)¶

The class is the main user window. Contains all the basic logic of the client module. The window configuration is created in QT Designer and loaded from converted file main_window_conv.py

add_contact(new_contact)¶

A method that adds a contact to the server and client BD. After updating the databases, it also updates the contents of the window.

add_contact_action(item)¶

The handler method for clicking the “Add” button

add_contact_window()¶

The method that creates the window is the dialog for adding a contact

clients_list_update()¶

A method that updates the contact list.

connection_lost()¶

Slot handler for loss of connection to the server. Issues a warning window and shuts down the application.

delete_contact(item)¶

A method that removes a contact from the server and client BD. After updating the databases, it also updates the contents of the window.

delete_contact_window()¶

A method that creates a window for deleting a contact.

history_list_update()¶

A method that fills in the corresponding QListView the history of correspondence with the current interlocutor.

make_connection(trans_obj)¶

A method for connecting signals and slots.

message(message)¶

Slot handler of incoming messages, performs decryption incoming messages and their saving in the message history. Requests the user if the message is not from the current one the interlocutor. If necessary, changes the interlocutor.

select_active_user()¶

The method is a handler for the double-click event on the contact list.

send_message()¶

The function of sending a message to the current interlocutor. Implements message encryption and sending.

set_active_user()¶

The method of activating the chat with the interlocutor.

set_disabled_input()¶

A method that makes input fields inactive

sig_205()¶

A slot that performs database updates at the command of the server.

start_dialog.py¶

class client.start_dialog.UserNameDialog¶

A class that implements a start dialog with a user login and password request.

click()¶

The handler method of the OK button.

add_contact.py¶

class client.add_contact.AddContactDialog(transport, database)¶

Dialog for adding a user to the contact list. Offers the user a list of possible contacts and adds the selected one to the contacts.

possible_contacts_update()¶

Method of filling in the list of possible contacts. Creates a list of all registered users except for those already added to contacts and myself.

update_possible_contacts()¶

Method for updating the list of possible contacts. Requests from the server the list of known users and updates the contents of the window.

del_contact.py¶

class client.del_contact.DelContactDialog(database)¶

Dialog for deleting a user from the contact list.
